p: Replication of SARS-CoV-2 requires copying of the viral RNA to make new strands, synthesis of new viral protein, including proteolytic cleavage of the large polypeptides into multiple units, co-assembly of the viral proteins and RNA to form virions, and processing of the virions for release from the host cells ( Fig.Â 1). These components involved in viral replication are potential therapeutic targets, as discussed below.
